A9E311F4C407452A8CB3DF162F497341.description: Distinguish when situations call for formal or informal speech

CD20AEB5E99840A79BD45194F0801E77.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 5 Language standards 1 and 3 here for specific expectations.)

D2E5CA1D50474AFD818FD55C4D1A173F.description: Determine when to add multimedia components or visual displays to enhance the development of main ideas or themes

B8886D0E8EB34D20B99CC84EA7998437.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

CA7C2704A1AB4CC98D9D40EDE7C724AB.description: Speak clearly and at an understandable pace

59669E2EF9124DCEAC78B59DD797E351.description: Determine facts and relevant descriptive details to support opinions, main ideas, and themes

F84216951614447EBB1AC06168E57EC9.description: Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

9B3F5F4949E647BA9A0FEDEAB84AF622.description: Explain how a speaker’s claim is supported by reasons and evidence

A8425DF44FB54A3BA2D7BF440B619C5E.description: Identify speaker’s points, claims, reasons, or evidence

4DBC343D8DB4412FB65812DD6203E347.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

E2EE0DDD0CAB48EE99D9C732B9EE3DFA.description: Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

96BF3D11052041DEAE7019580568FA4D.description: Identify key ideas presented during discussion

2101C6C4EDFC46749EDFBFC95FCC2F75.description: Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

65086D64AF814142B64CB24586A9072E.description: Connect comments to others' remarks to elaborate and contribute to the discussion

D85FC43A5DA94B86BBA152FBA4E292C8.description: Formulate questions and responses that contribute to the discussion

A43D2DA7B1514FD3A4F4EBC33DD8C946.description: Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.

923DD5F38F7240CB87B01230A7F89303.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

5AFD2972AC164BB781034D7A140647A7.description: Use background information and information read to contribute to discussion

317BB45F0A3E43289825D1F85295034B.description: Identify key ideas from reading material

49A595E9AEC148EEA9891F8163E2F9D5.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

3E8739E03EB14B7D912D92A467B9263B.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

96FD74AF8BFA4E42A9C0ABD84660660C.description: Identfify words that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships

70081C0898184C4593DB947F04C26D75.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

2945BF61ABEF442682FD9E2EA6C9EA21.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

AF03D717509A47E1A33627C2D17A5288.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

6D49AEFC70264B1D8922752AED2424D4.description: Identify figurative language, including similes and metaphors

3267E5B1059C43789C307329D38E3863.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

F5FE9B52EF4A4773836561F68CB3BC67.description: Explain the meaning of grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots

1E23A5DE9C174F04BDBADC39BF8F1992.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

E56F53F620904016A22350CDE7B668F3.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

099BF978FC30445DA551F8260C49BEE4.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

F87CB16D33B0440FA0F987C0174748AF.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

3B1FC99D4A0F4ABB94F848CBE07DC52D.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

210A8321472F4259AE439EC0F8421FAA.description: Identify tag questions and direct address phrases

21D0E923CF64409AA2A9F9004EABE30F.description: Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It's true, isn't it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

D687FB6E3B1942AF9143F8969E6AF3EF.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

7ACF9050420E4F6CB146481C2FC50253.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

1F916944CAB74B36BBD5F00A02BCE11F.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

52FF2914A47C4BB1AAC46E7071D7ED3C.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

3244D6FBB0154D98922A151A6A85EA0E.description: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]").

445821A495E447618FB758608757A75C.description: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]").

91E2F044C3454EF9A527C5CC7329D8FD.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

A89996C9F24841DAA210AF096C9C1FD9.description: Summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work

2C56D95FEB964EF5A1E37B6A5D1031AE.description: Use technology, including the Internet, and keyboarding skills to produce and publish writing

F3AA4600232948B2B00F3A4C836818BD.description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

19D590701F8B4DB7B43620E1374A2211.description: Develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and trying a new approach

808DE4005C10495FABD73B5AC05412C1.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. FCE0DC8B86374E6381FAEDCC0E6A258F.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

51E391A503D44712BC11957D0B1B4F2F.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

C11DD7DFADD34638BE3D35258DDA12CE.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

26F26A7017E84FEBA47C94A35C169D3C.description: Use dialogue, description, and pacing to develop experiences and events

6936651C6D894BA186F5B5954AD6A681.description: Develop a narrative beginning that establishes a situation and introduces a narrator and/or characters

6BCDAC9AFCE64F42A092B0F425F86414.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

563E909333844DD8AB853E48F31BE60E.description: Identify transitional words, phrases, and clauses

0F6E6CD6050E468A95C1643CAC6BC86D.description: Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

8127E6646F6449CD9963998E98B3986C.description: Identify the purpose of quotations in informational text

12C4679725EE47FF88DC610768873ABC.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
